content.question: In the following diagrams, elements are represented by <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, which form molecular compounds with one another. Which diagram represents a molecule that has a bent molecular geometry?

choices.label: The figure presents a Lewis diagram of a molecule. Atom X is bonded to atom Z by a single bond. Atom Z has three nonbonding pairs of electrons.
The figure presents a Lewis diagram of a molecule. Atom X  is bonded to 2 Z atoms, directly to the left and right, by single bonds. Atom X has two nonbonding pairs of electrons.
The figure presents a Lewis diagram of a molecule. Atom X  is bonded to 2 Z atoms, directly to the left and right, by single bonds. The two Z atoms each have three nonbonding pairs of electrons.
The figure presents a Lewis diagram of a molecule. Atom X  is bonded to 2 Z atoms, directly to the left and right, by double bonds. The two Z atoms each have two nonbonding pairs of electrons.

content.answer: The figure presents a Lewis diagram of a molecule. Atom X  is bonded to 2 Z atoms, directly to the left and right, by single bonds. Atom X has two nonbonding pairs of electrons.

skill.text: 6.C: Support a claim with evidence from representations or models at the particulate level, such as the structure of atoms and/or molecules.
